DataElement.preferredName: Patient Central Venous Catheter Scheduled Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to a patient planned to have a tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Central Venous Catheter Scheduled Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient planned to have a tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Scheduled Study Activity for Study Subject Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use.:A state of an activity (such as a procedure, visit, examination, etc.), which has been assigned with the designation of a time or/and date when the activity has to be performed to a particular study subject according to the study protocol.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.

Concepts.longName: Scheduled Study Activity for Study Subject
Concepts.definition: A state of an activity (such as a procedure, visit, examination, etc.), which has been assigned with the designation of a time or/and date when the activity has to be performed to a particular study subject according to the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have or has been
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have or has been scheduled to have an external tunneled central venous catheter (CVC) for 3 months or longer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have or is to be scheduled to have an external tunneled central venous catheter (CVC) and/or non-tunneled percutaneously inserted central catheter (PICC) for 3 months or longer?*
